fr.sorbonne_u.components.cvm

Interface ComponentVirtualMachineI

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    DistributedComponentVirtualMachineI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCVM, AbstractDistributedCVM

    public interface ComponentVirtualMachineI
    The interface ComponentVirtualMachineI defines the common behaviours of component virtual machines for component-based applications.

    Description

    A CVM is meant to create a set of components, to initialise and to interconnect them before starting them to execute the application. Applications can include concurrent components, which themselves rely on the Java Executor framework to execute requests with their own pool of threads. Hence, CVM also expose part of the ExecutorService interface regarding the life cycle of components and therefore their own life cycle.

    Invariant

     invariant              true            // TODO

    Created on : 2011-11-18

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addDeployedComponent(ComponentI component)
      add a component to the set of deployed components on the CVM.
      boolean allFinalised()
      return true if the CVM has been finalised (i.e. all of the locally deployed components in the CVM).
      boolean allStarted()
      return true if the CVM has been started (i.e. all of the locally deployed components in the CVM).
      boolean awaitTermination(long timeout, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      wait for the termination of the CVM (i.e. all of the locally deployed components in the CVM); inspired from the Java Executor framework.
      void deploy()
      instantiate, publish and interconnect the components.
      boolean deploymentDone()
      return true if the deployment has been done.
      void execute()
      perform the execute method on all of the deployed components, calling it as an asynchronous task.
      void finalise()
      perform the execute method on all of the deployed components, calling it as a synchronous task.
      java.lang.String getHostName()
      return the host name of this component virtual machine.
      boolean isDeployedComponent(ComponentI component)
      tests if a component is in the set of deployed components on the CVM.
      boolean isInitialised()
      true if the initialisation has been done.
      boolean isIntantiatedAndPublished()
      return true if all of the static components have been instantiated and their ports published when necessary.
      boolean isInterconnected()
      return true if all of the static components have their ports connected when necessary.
      boolean isShutdown()
      return true if the CVM has been shut down (i.e. all of the locally deployed components in the CVM).
      boolean isTerminated()
      return true if the CVM has terminated (i.e. all of the locally deployed components in the CVM).
      void logDebug(CVMDebugModesI dm, java.lang.String message)
      log an entry in the debugging trace.
      java.lang.String logPrefix()
      return the string that will be used to tag log entries for this CVM.
      void removeDeployedComponent(ComponentI component)
      remove a component from the set of deployed components on the CVM.
      void shutdown()
      shut down the CVM, synchronising with the other JVM when distributed, i.e. all of the deployed components in the CVM are shut down; inspired from the Java Executor framework.
      void shutdownNow()
      shut down the CVM now, synchronising with the other sites when distributed, i.e. all of the locally deployed components in the CVM are shut down; inspired from the Java Executor framework.
      void start()
      start the execution of the deployed components.
      boolean startStandardLifeCycle(long duration)
      start the complete standard life-cycle of the component virtual machine to execute the application.

      • startStandardLifeCycle

        boolean startStandardLifeCycle(long duration)
        start the complete standard life-cycle of the component virtual machine to execute the application.

        Contract

         pre    duration > 0
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if normal termination, false otherwise.

      • awaitTermination

        boolean awaitTermination(long timeout,
                         java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        wait for the termination of the CVM (i.e. all of the locally deployed components in the CVM); inspired from the Java Executor framework.

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum time to wait.
        unit - the time unit of the timeout argument.
        Returns:
        true if this executor terminated and false if the timeout elapsed before termination.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting.
